Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Howdy55
Reviews.Content: Love the Bleibtreu. Breakfast is great and staff too! However, if I have one complaint, it would be the should exchange phone that are currently in room for one more simple. Once, during a stay, I missed a very important call because, outwardly, there was no way to tell the ringer "muted." Boy, was I mad......

Reviews.Title: “centrally located hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Enzo P
Reviews.Content: simple and small room but clean, helpful staff, good kitchen (Deli) and centrally located. Would definetively stay again in this hotel when in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: teleaviv
Reviews.Content: Bleibtreu is a lovely, small and beautifully designed hotel in the heart of former West Berlin. The staff is super friendly and helpful. There's just a couple of minor drawbacks: The water in the shower, which, as somebody else pointed out, splashes all over the bathroom, also wasn´t always hot enough... and with €19 the breakfast buffet is somewhat overcharged. You can, however, order a la carte or go to any of the numerous places in the vicinity, such as the famous Literaturhaus on nearby Fasanenstrasse, which offers a better deal in a great atmosphere. All in all, though, Bleibtreu is a beautiful little hotel hotel and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just alright...”
Reviews.Author: Shane W
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business, and my usual hotel was completely booked. Bleibtreu was available and relatively inexpensive so I took it! Please fogive my "average" rating, as it has plenty of great benefits, such as a great location, and little extras (like the apple) were a nice touch of class.(though I was not aware that the minibar was free), and the employees in reception were great. All fine attributes of a great hotel. However, the room itself was very small (which was fine), but the bed was very small (I wouldn't recommend booking a single), the mattress was a little suspect, and it looked like they type of bed that you push up and pull down from the wall (a murphey bed). And I had a little bit of an issue with bugs biting me, or the feeling that they were - couldn't quite make it out. I feel like I am very forgiving of most things, and I travel around Europe a lot (so it's not a matter of high expectations) - but a hotel is a place for tired travellers to sleep, and the sleep was poor due to the conditions. Other than that, I would have given the hotel a "very good" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Reasonablly Priced”
Reviews.Author: travellingirlLSM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bleibtreu Hotel for 9 nights. The positives: free minibar, fridge in room, nice lighting, small balcony adjoining room, heated towel racks, wonderful front desk/concierge. Nearby grocery to stock up on snacks and drinks.Bleibtreu Cafe and Calcutta are nearby great restaurants. Interesting decor and nice steam room. Free apples in the room every day, as well as water, non alcoholic beer and natural soda. The negatives: First hour internet free, after that you pay by the hour.This was not the best since I do business through the internet and use it often for communication in the US. The shower had no barrier so the entire bathroom gets wet. It is manageable if you remove anything in the room that you don't want wet, especially from the floor. New Years Eve my room bill was WAYY overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy little boutique hotel in downtown Berlin”
Reviews.Author: hesspoint
Reviews.Content: I really liked our stay at the Bleibtreu. Ok the rooms are not exactly huge but very cosy and decorated with style. Everything was a little unusual and extraordinary. For example the Minibar is free (I am not kidding, I could not believe it myself at first) and refilled every day. You get a book as a present (not sure if it's any good or not but very nice idea). The ceiling light has step less dimming. And so on and so on. They also have a nice (but small) SPA with a steam bath. The location is not bad, just a few steps of the famous Kudamm. Though the Kudamm area was the gravitational center of Berlin when it was still separated, today it is a little far from the new Berlin center (Mitte, Potsdamer Platz etc.). But the KDW and the Kaiser Wilhelm Gedaechtniskirche are still worth a visit. You can park very near the hotel for 9 EUR for 24h. On Sundays and over night you can park for free in the street in front of the hotel (if you are lucky to find a parking space).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHDijkhuis
Reviews.Content: We travelled by car, but took our bicycles with us. A perfect combination, because parking was nearby and not very expensive. By bike city-centre was very close. But by foot the Kurfurstendam is only a few steps. The youthfull staff was very helpfull and friendly. We had one of the luxury rooms, it was very nice and roomy. If we visit Berlin again, Hotel Bleibtreu will be our choise again. The included restaurant is fine and comfortable, but prices are a bit higher then Berlin in general. Overal Berlin was a great city to visit and Hotel Bleibtreu was a good choise.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Berlin 10/5/2011”
Reviews.Author: Centerpond
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff at the Bleibtreu Hotel. Everyone was informative and eager to make our stay the best it could be. The location is not close to all of the attractions but that is the beauty of it - it is a great place to unwind after a busy day sight-seeing. The restaurants nearby offer a variety of cuisines and all that we experienced were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed city hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoxBxl
Reviews.Content: Relaxed anad funky US style diner and bar; the food was very good in fact, and the choice o of drinks also surprisingly good. Very friendly staff too. The bar is still open for a cocktail after getting back from late meetings or theatre. More for lesiure than for business travel. The room was small, but immaculately clean and functional; the bathroom was adequately sized and modern, though did not have much space to put your things. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The hammam type space downstairs is a bit small, and the steamroom was not really warm - so improvements could be made here. Added bonus: a truely wonderfull small flowershop in the same building, specialising on rare type of roses - a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in quiet location but the City is easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: bgtravellers
Reviews.Content: Our book group of 7 ladies recently visited Berlin and we had 6 rooms at the hotel. I stayed in a twin room which was very comfortable, with plenty of space. The free mini bar and the fresh apple by the bedside were nice touches. All the staff were really friendly and went out of their way to be helpful, also their English was very good. We had a lunch and the lighter breakfast at the hotel (not the all you can eat buffet) and both meals were great. We enjoyed the outside courtyard area where we had lunch one day and a cup of tea after a busy day another day. There were many restaurants nearby to choose from. The hotel was located not far from a bus stop and the S Bahn station was not much further than that. I would recommend any visitors to buy the Berlin Welcome Card as this included all our travel on buses and trains, plus money off most attractions we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick, rooms are small, free mini bar, close to shops and restuarants, staff speak English and very helpful. Food is great within the hotel close to U bahn but it is a 15 minute walk to the Europa centre. I would recommend this hotel as its very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay - still a very good choice in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Fotobear
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent deal through the German railways' website (49 Euros for a single room) and so I decided to stay here again. I like the rooms and bathrooms, my only criticism remains the size of the 'desk'. It just about fits a laptop, any notes etc have to be put on a stool or side table. Wireless internet signal is rather weak, too. Otherwise just perfect, with a pleasant mix of tourists, artists and business travellers - but thankfully no large groups! From here it's easy to travel around Berlin by public transport, and taxis are also easy to get (ask reception to call one for you, rather than trying to find one yourself on the street).

Reviews.Title: “Total gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: strudledoodle
Reviews.Content: Not one negative thing to say about this hotel. Well okay just one there is no pool but we knew that before we booked anyway. we had one twin room one double room and one family room each were different but all fantastic. plenty of room and plenty of storage.each day we were given 2 bottles of water 2 bottles of beer and 2 bottles of coca cola as our free minibar this definatley scores points. We ate in the courtyard a number of days(we were there for 2 weeks) as they had different set menu evryday for lunchtime and evening all incredible value. Breakfast was included in the price and was amazing.all you can eat buffet and cooked breafast made to order at no extra charge. The staff were amongst the nicest I have ever come across. Hotel is located about 100m from the main street Kurfustandam(sorry for spelling) and took no more than 5mins to walk to the heart of Berlin. S Bahn stop is no more than 200m away and was fast and efficient(not sure of cost as ours was free with our athletics tickets). I wish more hotels were like this

Reviews.Title: “Missing some touches”
Reviews.Author: HotelfanNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good hotel to stay when in Berlin, however it is not cheap and I have difficulty to rate if the value/price ratio is a good one. Location is really good, in a very cozy little street with lots of boutiques, beautifully decorated for Christmas. We paid 90 euros per night excl breakfast, but the rooms are nothing exceptional. They are rather small with no place to sit or write if you need to. My husband had taken his laptop with him, and had to have it on his knees while working. Breakfast we got separately and it was much better than the overpriced breakfast (19 euros) from the buffet (i.e. buffet was totally B&B quality; basic). There were really scrooge with amenities though, no body lotion or soap, which makes me think if this was on purpose because of the "low" rate we paid. The girls at the reception are fab and very helpful. Blue Bar is good and service is efficient. They have a limited carte with cocktails but it is OK. I also took a hot chocolate, which turned out to be cacao with milk... In the neighborhood there are many nice bakeries for your breakfast and some upmarket restaurants. I personally like German cuisine and always go back to Zillermarkt around the corner for the Eisbein, a Berlin specialty. Careful: if you have a low rate they refuse to credit any air miles. Couple of other things that disappointed me: no aromatologiy perfumes in the corridors, furniture in the room is really not beautiful, and being very familiar with interior decoration it is also not what the hotel claims to be, warm water in the shower took some minutes to come, I did not try the spa treatments which were overpriced. All in all OK, but I may do some more research to find something else next time I am in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Yet Very Friendly - An Understated Gem”
Reviews.Author: PerryM
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel extremely reasonably priced, but it is oozing charm and style - and has very friendly and obliging staff. The room was on the small side but well decorated and with all the amenities you might need. I particularly liked the way in which the florist next door displayed their wares in the approach to the hotel - some great advent displays with candles. The espresso bar at the front was great for a quick breakfast or beer. The U-Bahn is a good 10-15 minutes away but the S-Bahn at Savigny Platz was much more convenient and down a street lined with great bars and restaurants. Charlottenburg is no longer 'where it's at' in Berlin, but has great shopping (KaDeWe is close by) and is a welcome retreat in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Charlottenburg”
Reviews.Author: FrankfurtGypsetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Bleibtreu during the days of Berlinale 2010. The location in Charlottenburg is a bit off the center of Berlin so you have to be aware that for the usual tourist attractions you have to travel a bit (subway or taxi about 15-30min). The hotel has a friendly but modern and a bit quirky feel. The downstairs restaurant offers very good reasonably priced meals and snacks as well as breakfast/brunch. It seems to be a trendy place as we saw some german actors coming for breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Super great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Adrian123_16
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bleibtreu during the first week of August. The people at the hotel are great- service oriented and friendly. Near the Savignyplatz s-bahn and into city centre in minutes. Room was perfect- clean and the bathroom was quite large. Kept the room clean and gave me great towel service! Great restaurants near by. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Satu B
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Bleibtreu during our weekend trip to Berlin. The service of the hotel staff was great during the whole stay. They provided us with tips on nice restaurants and even checked the movie times for us when we wanted to see a movie at the local movie theater. The room was quite small but had everything you need including minibar with free drinks which was a nice surprise. The room was very clean and was tidied up every day. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood in Charlottenburg but it has good connections to everywhere in the city. The Savignyplatz train station is close by. There's restaurants on the same street when you walk towards Savignyplatz so you don't have to look far for a place to eat any time at the day. The hotel is located on the side street of the shopping street Kurfurerstendamm so also shopping possibilities are close by. Overall great small hotel with friendly staff and good location for exploring the city. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location – nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelmutNassauer
Reviews.Content: The Bleibtreu in Berlin is a nice hotel with attached bar in a quiet street very close to Kurfürstendamm. So its a perfect location if your center of business is the old 80ies West- Berlin that manifests around Ku'damm – if you're here for leisure, you'll find lots of nice bars and restaurants around, especially around Savignyplatz. The hotel's decoration and overall design dates very obviously back to the mid-1990ies. But nevertheless, glass, the usage of light coloured woods, and some strange objects of decoration draw at least a complete and coherent picture of german 90ies design. Keep the hotel as it is and in 10-15 years and more this will be a highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Prison chic”
Reviews.Author: ptakacs
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended Charlottenburg, which I found charming, and I got the Bleibtreu online. The rooms have a cute, IKEA design, with square wooden furniture, a bit like a grown-up playroom. The concept is trendy, but the reality is terrible. There is no place to sit except a striped easy chair (read "prison stripes"), and a three-legged stool at a minuscule desk. All the drawers have knobs like a mineral stone that poke you. There is a remote control for the lights that doesn't work, the TV is balky, and the internet connection was a nightmare, for which I got charged. The waitress at the restaurant got my order wrong. I felt like I was in the Gulag. I know it sounds extreme, and some people found this hotel charming, but I really thought it was nightmarish. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business & leisure”
Reviews.Author: Fotobear
Reviews.Content: I chose the Bleibtreu for its location (central), decor (opposite of run-off-the-mill business style chain hotels) and price (under 100 euros per night) and all three counts I'd give it 10/10. Staff are very friendly and helpful and as I was here on business I appreciated their efficient magic taxi call button - I never had to wait more the 3 minutes for a taxi to arrive. As for value for money, the price for the room itself was very attractive but the extra charges for internet access are a nuisance (is it really worth the receptionist's time to handle a charge 1.90 euros???), and although it was made clear at the time of booking that breakfast was not included in the room rate I still think that 19 euros is a ridiculous amount to charge, especially in a city like Berlin where one can easily have a proper meal with wine for less than that. I would also expect that at such a price they'd serve fresh bread rolls rather than re-heated ones (as happened on my second morning). Although the room was spacious, there was no desk, just a tiny shelf big enough for a laptop but nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: YellowCrazyFish
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 nights in March for a business stay. ROOMS I have booked a Superior Room. On Arrival I got a room on 1st floor facing the street, smelling like cigarette smoke. Rechecked with the Reception to change the room, but due to the fair everything was fullybooked. As I had to hurry for a business dinner and couldn´t discuss for long. But when I came back from dinner the room air was fresh again, I had some extra towels and an extra cushion as requested :-D And unlike as suspected the room was quiet as well even if it was facing the street. Bathroom was very clean with a lovely rainshower, hot water and very good water pressure! I did love the free of charge minibar which included mineral water, lemonade and alcoholfree beer. BREAKFAST The breakfast buffet is really nice and provides everything for a sweet or hearty breakfast. They offer 4 different types of bread, fresh fruit juices, several sorts of cream cheese, cold cuts, eggs, vegetables, fruits. You can mix your own cereals and they have an egg station. HOTEL Sadly it was still winter in Berlin, so we could not use the nice patio or the other outdoor gastronomy. LOCATION Absolutley Perfect! Between Kurfuerstendamm and Kantstrasse in the middle of Charlottenburg with a million restaurants and bars around. Transfer from Berlin Tegel airport by taxi about 15 minutes and not far away from the fairground. Shopping around Kudamm, Savignyplatz and KaDeWe in walking distance. This location in Charlottenburg might be not too convenient if you want to spend a lot of time in Berlin Mitte or Prenzlauer Berg, but as Berlin is big you will never have the perfect location for every part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, except location.”
Reviews.Author: senoritamaria34
Reviews.Content: Calm, clean, good restaurant, large rooms, languages : english and german, 20min from Tegel airport by cab, a 10min-walk to the subway line U1 then 30min to the Brandeburg Gate (2 changes)...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: traveladdictSurrey
Reviews.Content: The Bleibteu was one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in. The room was lovely and we were given a free mini bar for the whole stay. We explored Berlin extensively on foot and this hotel provided an excellent base. Had we stayed elsewhere my impression of the city could have been different. The Bleibtreu is in a gorgeous area that is so peaceful and there are fantastic restaurants and pubs. You will not need to take taxis if you stay here as everything is on your doorstep. We would highly recommend cafe Bleibtreu for reasonable food. The one thing that I would say about the city as a whole is that hot drinks are really expensive, so I just bought teabags and asked for a cup of hot water at the hotel bar. Oh and one other thing full marks to anyone who gets in to the freezing plunge pool in the basement!!

Reviews.Title: “Bleibtreu excellent”
Reviews.Author: Enixam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just off the main shopping street K'damm . It is within walking distance of Zoo station. Decor is quirky ,bed placed diagonally different colour schemes on every floor. Objets d'art to amuse the traveller placed in unlikely locations. breakfast very generous. staff pleasant and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melblib
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, with efficient reception and checkin. Our room was quite large and looked over the quiet tree-lined street. Designer touches at the property are starting to age, but are still very nice. The location is terrirfic, just off Kurfurstendamm, now a pleasant tree-lined upmarket street, since all the noisy tourist action has moved to Unter der Linden. Bleibtreu street is well served by public transport, and the bus from Tegel airport stops at the end of the street. There are many restaurants around, and also a restaurant at the front of the hotel. Breakfast was really nice and included smoked salmon, toast, fresh fruit as well as the usual breads and spreads. Price is the main drawback. We only stayed here because we couldn't find anything cheaper on a busy weekend, despite booking months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Like a hostel room”
Reviews.Author: ppmac
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune to stay here last week. The hotel was highly recommended by the travel agent, who asked me to check out the website. The snaps on the site are very misleading & do not indicate the actual size of the room. The reception was OK & the lift was not very nice. The doors are glass & not very safe. The room itself was a shocker. It was like any hostel room anywhere else in Europe with an attached bathroom. The whole room was less than 100 sq ft. Easily the smallest hotel room I have stayed in. I am surprised at the many reviews about the spacious rooms, very misleading. We tried to change hotels the moment we saw the room & the hotel would not let us without charging the full day's stay. There was one bed (with wheels at one end) & an average mattress. There was a 14 inch CRT television (thought they were obsolete!) & a small minibar. Once I opened my bag, there was no place to move around the room. The room was extremely poorly lit & gloomy. The bathroom was about 25 sq ft & with extremely small area to shower with a grossly inadequate shower curtain which let all the water out. If this is a boutique hotel, i would much rather have the regular old hotels. Furniture, decor was also very tacky. 4 star is a gross over rating (even for Europe) I have stayed at many 3 stars in Paris which had larger rooms. (and that is really saying something) The Breakfast was good & the location was great. But 160 Euro per night was a ridiculous price to pay. At 80 Euro, it would be a great place to stay. (thanks to the location & the breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Boutique type hotel off the Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: rhino_oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend here for 3 nights. Despite my friend booking via the hotel website they lost his booking, and as such had what I would describe as "run of house" room for the first night. Was very pokey. Looks like all the rooms were furnished with the same type and amount of furniture, and in a room this small it made it quite cramped. To the hotel's credit they moved us to a bigger room for the following two nights, which was a cavern by comparison - this was fronting the road rather than down the long corridor that runs from the street to the back of the building. Rooms come with a bar fridge with free (!) drinks like coke and sparkling water. Fridge in the first room didn't work so well, but it was so cold outdoors I just put stuff on the window ledge to stay "refrigerated". There is a supermarket on the street one block west if you want more provisions. Breakfast which was included in the price was great. Heaps of food to chose from - cold cuts, cereals, fruits, eggs (cooked to your liking by the chef), toast, breads with a large variety of spreads, tea coffee and fruit juice. Was too easy to go nuts and skip lunch as a result. Definitely the best point of the hotel if you ask me. There is also a bar situated at the front of the hotel. S-bahn station (Savignyplatz) is about two blocks north over the Ku'damm, so location is quite good. There are also heaps of eating options located around the station, especially on Bleibtreustrasse just before the S-Bahn. Coming from Tegel you can either take the 109 bus which goes down the Ku'damm, or catch a cab for about EUR15.

Reviews.Title: “Bleibtreu - good base”
Reviews.Author: HRHLonodn
Reviews.Content: Nice contemporary hotel in quiet but central location. Ground floor has trendy deli and bar -nice for a coffee/drink in the late afternoon. The rooms are not quite up to the standard as the ground floor. They are clean and large but not particularly stylish. A lot of excellent neighbourhood restaurants nearby (Lubitsch was very good). Hotel staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lansammy
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during the world cup soccer in july. the staff were really nice, very attentive. the room was beautiful and big and the washroom was clean and very large. it was hot and we were a little disappointed that there wasn't any air conditioning but the staff assured us that it cools at night and we would be fine, they were right. the location is a little out of the way, but it's worth it. the restaurant was also really great, great food and staff. overall we had an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: SB-DLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and found it very pleasant. The furnishings are perhaps not as slick as your newer boutique hotels but still nice, comfortable elegant and quirky. I loved the fact that the TV could be concealed (not a TV person), and the windows could be opened (fed up of these climatised big hotels). I loved the fact that you could use the spa 24/7 and I really loved the fact that brunch is served unitl 14:00 or "whenever people stop eating". Coming from London, I was really warmed by this easy going attitude. The cafe and garden downstairs is charming, the people are lovely. At around €80/ night, I also thought it was great value. Oh, and the food is pretty good too. I hear that some of the rooms can be quite small, but the one we were given was very spacious with a nice sized bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: northbritish
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, if slightly quirky hotel. Right in the centre yet on a quiet side street (slept like a baby). Easy to get to public transport. Amazing breakfast (worth maybe paying a little more for the hotel). Warm reception, all staff so very helpful. Beds really comfortable. Accepts dogs; all in all a very personal hotel, with a great atmosphere; fantastic bar/cafe open all day. I could not falt this hotel in any shape or form and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: christine-bradmore
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Belibtreu, great little hotel just off the main Kudamm. The reception staff were very good spoke good english and very helpful. We had a room on the second floor which was at the front of the hotel but very quiet. The room was a good size as was the bathroom. Very clean and modern, need a degree in electronics to work out the lighting system but great fun. Breakast was enormous choice and very good. Would recommend this hotel for its location, staff, cleanliness, all extremely good at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a motel- not a real hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdjlg
Reviews.Content: From the photos on the websites I looked it, Bleibtreu looked very modern and design oriented and like a great place to stay. Unfortunately, what I didn't know is that while relatively "design" oriented, the property is more like an upscale motel than a hotel. It's a very small property with even smaller rooms. While designed with a modern sensibility the rooms were extremely small (I had a single with one twin bed - awful!). The lighting is too dim in the rooms and the bathrooms, while having very pretty tiling, lacked products and amenities other than one tube of hair/body wash. There is DSL available in the rooms but 5 euro for 2 hours (almost $10). The staff waivered between rigidly Germanic and somewhat nice, but no raves here. I'll say they were perfunctory in their job performance. Additionally the cost here is over $100 euro/night and definitely overpriced. It's also really only conveniently located to the main shopping street of high end stores - if you're not interested in that it's metro or taxis. The breakfast buffet in the morning I will say was excellent. If you need a place to stay one night and you don't mind small rooms, you may not mind it, but overall I'd have to say that there must be better alternatives in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vamoots
Reviews.Content: The Bleibtreu is an eclectic small hotel on a quieter street just off well-known Kurfurstendamm Street in Berlin. The mosaic tiles and the carpets are colorful and lively, and the rooms are decorated by someone with a flair for the funky. The staff graciously attended to our every need.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bspoll
Reviews.Content: Great location , great staff , great rooms - I could go on and on . Stayed during the World Cup and couldnt fault the place from the lovely coourtyard to the rooms and the bar , a wonderful experience that should be held as the gold standard for all hotels thank you Bleibtreu , I will Stay True Forever

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: usagirl
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after seeing it reviewed in a number of places. It is in a super location (especially for shopping & dining) and was excellent value for money, though I strongly recommend booking an "executive" room as they are larger. Lots of small touches make it a good cheap & cheerful hotel but don't expect bathrobes or a swell lobby. Breakfast was totally fine (no flies as someone complained about below) and service was very good. Try the restaurant Lubtisch a few blocks away on same street.

Reviews.Title: “business a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: travell_a_lot
Reviews.Content: Great location for this trendy side street hotel some what hidden from sight but don't let this put you off. Resturant very quiet in the evening so we held our business meeting there staff very obliging. Foe those who like gadgets lots to play with in the rooms!Lights I meant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect blend of great hotel, location, price...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the best. Great location on quiet street just off Ku Damm - perfect strolling street for designer shops. Good overall design feel to the hotel. Rooms smallish but comfortable. (Be aware only 3 twins in the building!). Downstairs a combination of bar, restaurant, deli, florist and pavement cafe make this a superb base. Dinner in the restaurant was excellent (ate there twice). Easy access to all key attractions and shops and away from the noise of Mitte. Taxi ride to Brandenburg Gate about 8-10 euros. Explore the area surrounding the hotel. Savignyplatz has excellent bars and cafes. Wonderful coffee and fruity flans at Cafe Savigny (and worth checking out how far the staff can suck in their cheeks and look down their noses at you - great fun!). Zing - a new asian influenced restaurant just across the road - with outdoor dining - offers a great range of Thai, Chinese, Japanese etc One tip - see the Guggenheim exhibition.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Bleibtreu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days at Bleibtreu Hotel last month, and I really loved this boutique hotel. Very good service, well designed rooms. Great location. Food at the hotel restaurant was very good, and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Flies on our breakfast.............mmmm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having read about the Hotel Bleibtreu in the HIP HOTELS guide, I was looking forward to staying there. If you choose to stay at this hotel throughout the summer I would highly recommend that you DON'T. The rooms aren't air conditioned and incredibly hot. The temperature was soaring at 36 degrees celcius and we pretty much spent our nights hot and bothered.....and sleepless! The front desk were unable to supply us with a fan! In addition, I was very upset at breakfast times. As we all know flies love the summer. The coldmeats, salmon and cheeses weren't covered therefore flies were resting upon the food every morning. As you can pretty much imagine, we didn't feel like eating after having to look at this. The front desk weren't helpful and the rooms were way too small. I know it's always nice to stay at a 'Hip Hotel', but after this unfortunate experience I would certainly stay at a chain hotel such as The Hyatt were service and care is guaranteed!
